hanzi-su-wiki:
疎

Значения

Небрежный, невнимательный; сторониться; чуждый; неправильный, редкость, халатность, сенсация

Мнемоника

Сокращение. При родах младенец сжат в пучок 束, комочек. Изредка у него подворачивается нога 疋, что затрудняет роды.

Варианты

疏, 踈
purpleculture_pinyin:
shū
Japanese variant of 疏 [shu1]
Японский вариант 疏 [shu1]
rtega_mnemonic:
疎疎RS踈neglect, careless, lax, alienate
  • bag 束 stepped 𤴔/𧾷 upon
疏
heisig_constituent: alienate, zoo, critters, stop, footprint, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth
heisig_story: Zoo . . . bundle. Note that the element for zoo is flattened out on the left just as leg (Frame 1372) had been. This is the only time we will meet this form in this book.
koohiiStory1: [True story] In Osaka the homeless (the alienated) live in large numbers around the city zoo. Picture them in winter all bundled up in rags trying to keep warm, alienated from the society, living literally worst than the animals in the zoo who at least are bundled in their natural furs and have pens to live in sheltered from the elements.
koohiiStory2: This kanji is so strange that it was alienated at the kanji zoo. The bundle of joy stork bundles this kanji up and takes it to a kanji foster home.
jp_example_words:
疎か(おろそか): neglect, negligence, carelessness
過疎(かそ): depopulation
jp_readingExamples: 疎い (うと.い), 疎む (うと.む)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A coat rack will turn into a bundle of sticks if you neglect it. When you neglect a coat rack, the weight from the coats will pull all of the arms off, leaving it as a sparse stick.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this sparse, neglected coat rack. All of its arms and the coats that were on it have fallen off and are in a big pile on the ground.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You go up to the neglected coat rack and try to make things right by cleaning it with soap (そ). But no matter how much you scrub, it won't get clean, the arms won't go back on.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you neglect something for too long, not even a good soap scrub will bring it back. That goes for humans too. Take care of yourselves. Use soap.
Ru_Meaning: alienate, rough, neglect, shun, sparse, penetrate
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 口 (рот), 木 (дерево), 止 (останавливать)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the roll of cloth (⺪) and the bundle (束) are estranged

[①]［shū］
［《廣韻》所葅切，平魚，生。］
亦作“疎1”。亦作“踈1”。亦作“1”。
(1)开浚；开通。
(2)分开；分散。
(3)分赐；分给。
(4)分布；陈列。
(5)松弛，解除。
(6)洗涤，清除。
(7)撤退。
(8)疏远，不亲近。
(9)指离间，使疏远。
(10)轻视。
(11)冷淡；淡漠。
(12)远亲。亦泛指关系疏远的人。
(13)粗糙。亦指粗食。
(14)指粗布。
(15)稀疏；稀少。
(16)疏忽；松懈。
(17)生疏；不擅长。
(18)疏陋；浅薄。
(19)粗略；不精密。
(20)粗拙；粗劣。
(21)迂阔；不切实际。
(22)久；长远。
(23)大。
(24)迟缓；迟钝。
(25)空虚；贫乏。
(26)爽朗；超逸。
(27)鲜明貌。参见“疏疏”。
(28)雕刻；刻画。
(29)指窗户。
(30)通“蔬”。泛指蔬菜。
(31)通“梳”。梳子。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shū］
["Guangyun" cut and cut, flat fish, raw. ]
Also known as "Nine 1". Also known as "Ge 1". Also known as "1".
(1) Open Jun; Open.
(2) Separate; Disperse.
(3) Distribute; distribute.
(4) Distribution; display.
(5) Relax and relieve.
(6) Wash and remove.
(7) Retreat.
(8) To be alienated and not close.
(9) Refers to separation and alienation.
(10) Contempt.
(11) Indifferent; indifferent.
(12) Distant relatives. It also refers to people who are alienated.
(13) Rough. Also refers to coarse food.
(14) Refers to coarse cloth.
(15) Sparse; sparse.
(16) Negligence; slack.
(17) Unfamiliar; not good at it.
(18) Sparse and crude; shallow.
(19) Rough; not precise.
(20) Clumsy; crude.
(21) Roundabout; unrealistic.
(22) Long; long-term.
(23) Big.
(24) Slow; slow.
(25) Emptiness; poverty.
(26) Hearty; super easy.
(27) Bright appearance. See "Sparse".
(28) Carving; portraying.
(29) Refers to windows.
(30) Through "vegetables". Refers to vegetables in general.
(31) Through "comb". comb.
(32) Through "comb

Name meaning

shū
яп. вм. 疏
Radicals: 疋, 束  (coat-rack, bundle)
Meaning Mnemonic
A coat rack will turn into a bundle of sticks if you neglect it. When you neglect a coat rack, the weight from the coats will pull all of the arms off, leaving it as a sparse stick.
Picture this sparse, neglected coat rack. All of its arms and the coats that were on it have fallen off and are in a big pile on the ground.
Reading Mnemonic
You go up to the neglected coat rack and try to make things right by cleaning it with soap (そ). But no matter how much you scrub, it won't get clean, the arms won't go back on.
If you neglect something for too long, not even a good soap scrub will bring it back. That goes for humans too. Take care of yourselves. Use soap.
